1 ''' Animation helper class '''
2 
3 
4 '''
5 Each dataunit can have its own figure or draw on the same figure as the rest
6 However, each class instance will have its own set of data
7 
8 Inspired by: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40126176/fast-live-plotting-in-matplotlib-pyplot
9 '''
10 from tamu_sa import run_config as rc
11 if rc.visualize:
12  import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
13  from matplotlib.animation import FFMpegWriter
14 
15 import time
16 
17 class Animate:
18  # TODO: set default values
19  def __init__(self,number=1, xlim=(10,10), ylim=(10,10), gridSize=1, linewidth=5, markerType='o', markerSize=5, sleep=0.005, order=10):
20  '''
21  Grabs the current figure instance based on number
22  '''
23  self.xlim = xlim
24  self.ylim = ylim
25  # Only add subplot if initializing!
26  # TODO: Add legend during init phase
27  if not plt.fignum_exists(number):
28  # Figure doesnt exist, so initialize stuff
29  fig = plt.figure(number)
30  ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1,1,1)
31  if len(xlim) != 0 and len(ylim) != 0:
32  ax1.set_xlim(self.xlim[0], self.xlim[1])
33  ax1.set_ylim(self.ylim[0], self.ylim[1])
34  else:
35  ax1.set_autoscalex_on(True)
36  ax1.set_autoscaley_on(True)
37  else:
38  fig = plt.figure(number)
39  #ax1 = fig.gca()
40  ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1,1,1)
41 
42  # markerType = 'xc'
43  self.lines, = ax1.plot([],[],markerType, markersize=markerSize, linewidth=linewidth)
44  ax1.set_zorder(order)
45  ax1.patch.set_visible(False) #may not be necessary
46 
47  #ax1.grid(True)
48 
49  # note that the first draw comes before setting data
50  fig.canvas.draw()
51 
52  #self.axbackground = fig.canvas.copy_from_bbox(ax1.bbox)
53  plt.show(block=False)
54 
55  # data holder
56  self.xdata = []
57  self.ydata = []
58 
59  # sleep amount (secs)
60  self.sleep = sleep
61 
62  #Listen to mouse click for pausing
63  cid = fig.canvas.mpl_connect('button_press_event', self.onclick)
64  self.pause = False
65 
66  # set things for class-wide access
67  self.fig = fig
68  self.ax1 = ax1
69 
70  '''update the figure '''
71  def update(self,new_data):
72  ''' new_data is a tuple of (x,y) consist of updated data
73  '''
74  self.xdata.append(new_data[0])
75  self.ydata.append(new_data[1])
76  self.lines.set_xdata(self.xdata)
77  self.lines.set_ydata(self.ydata)
78 
79  #sleep
80  time.sleep((self.sleep))
81 
82  # cache background
83  #self.axbackground = self.fig.canvas.copy_from_bbox(self.ax1.bbox)
84 
85  #self.fig.canvas.restore_region(self.axbackground)
86  if self.pause == True:
87  plt.waitforbuttonpress()
88 
89  # Bug when saving animation, keep ax size fixed
90  self.ax1.set_xlim(self.xlim[0], self.xlim[1])
91  self.ax1.set_ylim(self.ylim[0], self.ylim[1])
92 
93  self.ax1.draw_artist(self.lines)
94  #self.fig.canvas.blit(self.ax1.bbox)
95  self.fig.canvas.update()
96  self.fig.canvas.flush_events()
97 
98  def onclick(self, event):
99  self.pause ^= True
100  #fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(cid)
101 
102 
103 ''' Helper class to help save animations '''
104 class SaveAnimation:
105  def __init__(self, figNumber, outfile):
106  #self.fig = plt.gcf() #assuming we are focused on 1 plt
107  self.fig = plt.figure(figNumber)
108  metadata = dict(title='Movie Test', artist='Matplotlib', comment='Movie support!')
109  self.writer = FFMpegWriter(fps=15, metadata=metadata)
110  self.writer.setup(self.fig, outfile, dpi=100)
111 
112  def update(self):
113  #self.fig = animateObject.fig #may not be necessary here...
114  self.writer.grab_frame()
115 
116  def save(self):
117  self.writer.finish()
